It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, small, and often fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in association with specific fungal symbionts. Its botanical structure includes parallel-veined leaves and a short, erect stem that supports its clustered inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
